Turn mypy:assignment/misc/import-not-found on

Both 'assignment' and 'misc' and 'import-not-found' error codes has been
disabled before due to the code not being ready for it. This patch
delivers amends to the code base, and enables the rule that must be
enabled.

commit.message:
Add the MyPy type checker

Mypy is a static type checker for Python. Type checkers help ensure that
you’re using variables and functions in your code correctly. It's about
time I give it a try! This commit lays down basic configuration with a
pretty big ignore list. The ignore list is not to stick here, but rather
temporarly disable the rules until they are resolved.

verification.payload:
tree ea7e4bfdcce8f24a0f319894af71074e8b353ed7

author Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1707563498 +0200
committer Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1707563654 +0200

Add the MyPy type checker

Mypy is a static type checker for Python. Type checkers help ensure that
you’re using variables and functions in your code correctly. It's about
time I give it a try! This commit lays down basic configuration with a
pretty big ignore list. The ignore list is not to stick here, but rather
temporarly disable the rules until they are resolved.

commit.message:
Use ruff 0.1.* instead of pinned one

Ruff uses a custom versioning scheme that uses the minor version number
for breaking changes and the patch version number for bug fixes.

Merge pull request #86 from ikalnytskyi/chore/wsgiscopes-tests

Use a client facade in test_wsgiscopes.py

commit.message:
Use a client facade in test_wsgiscopes.py

Previously a bare Flask test client has been used in the tests to make a
request and trigger an endpoint execution. This was error prone, since
the wrong route could have been requested due to a silly typo and we
wouldn't even know. The facade is designed to solve this by always
checking that underlying requests succeed.

verification.payload:
tree baa6faeebe1b3367e6f9593c2703f0cb4f2b7cd2
parent 2fe38e8dba09f146069e4881532790be11a821ef
author Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1701733125 +0200
committer Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1701733962 +0200

Use a client facade in test_wsgiscopes.py

Previously a bare Flask test client has been used in the tests to make a
request and trigger an endpoint execution. This was error prone, since
the wrong route could have been requested due to a silly typo and we
wouldn't even know. The facade is designed to solve this by always
checking that underlying requests succeed.

commit.message:
Add 'application' and 'request' ASGI scopes

ASGI is a spiritual successor to WSGI, intended to provide a standard
interface between async-capable Python web servers, frameworks, and
applications. Most web frameworks (e.g., FastAPI, Starlette) sit on top
of this protocol.

Resolves: #80

commit.message:
Add 'application' and 'request' WSGI scopes

WSGI is a specification that describes how a web server communicates
with web applications, and how web applications can be chained together
to process one request (PEP 3333). Most *synchronous* web frameworks for
Python (e.g., Flask, Django, Pyramid) sit on top of this specification.

Resolves: #81

with web applications, and how web applications can be chained together
to process one request (PEP 3333). Most *synchronous* web frameworks for
Python (e.g., Flask, Django, Pyramid) sit on top of this specification.

commit.message:
Throw RuntimeError from .pop() when stack is empty

The `picobox.pop()` function used to throw `IndexError` when invoked
with an empty stack. This was never an intentional move, and just
happened because we weren't careful enough.

This patch makes the `.pop()` function to throw `RuntimeError` instead
with a good-looking error message saying that there's no boxes on stack,
similar to what `picobox.put()` or `picobox.get()` are doing.

This patch doesn't introduce a major bump in the version despite being a
backward incompatible change. Invoking `.pop()` when stack is empty is a
symptom of a poorly designed application, and should not be happening in
the first place.

verification.payload:
tree ea727557070ef91497ffeeca2a4d0c26ced166b7
parent d784746300ab74c06f1fe484f8700b8b975680da
author Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1701302539 +0200
committer Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1701303078 +0200

Throw RuntimeError from .pop() when stack is empty

The `picobox.pop()` function used to throw `IndexError` when invoked
with an empty stack. This was never an intentional move, and just
happened because we weren't careful enough.

This patch makes the `.pop()` function to throw `RuntimeError` instead
with a good-looking error message saying that there's no boxes on stack,
similar to what `picobox.put()` or `picobox.get()` are doing.

This patch doesn't introduce a major bump in the version despite being a
backward incompatible change. Invoking `.pop()` when stack is empty is a
symptom of a poorly designed application, and should not be happening in
the first place.

verification.payload:
tree e87e1528078eb3ee74305d2b6fc3124c38c55ade
parent fbc02ea61d8c65588e9c74724611715920711728
parent 13a7711405611edad596cfb7f75f35255d97bf67

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1701047665 +0200

Merge pull request #79 from ikalnytskyi/bug/pass-with-coroutines

Keep an async function marker when `@pass_` is used

commit.message:
Keep an async function marker when @pass_ is used

Unfortunately, when the `@picobox.pass_()` decorator is used, a wrapped
coroutine function (i.e. an async function) loses its a coroutine
function marker, i.e. `inspect.iscoroutinefunction()` returns `False`
for such function.

Turns out that there are a lot of software out there that support both
sync and async interfaces, and may choose one based on the type of a
passed function. For instance, Starlette, a web-framework, checks a
provided route function for being a coroutine function before choosing
how to execute in (i.e. in an event loop or in a thread pool).

This patch fixes `@picobox.pass_()` to return a coroutine function when
a wrapped function is also a coroutine function.

Fixes #78

verification.payload:
tree e87e1528078eb3ee74305d2b6fc3124c38c55ade
parent fbc02ea61d8c65588e9c74724611715920711728
author Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1701042672 +0200
committer Ihor Kalnytskyi <ihor@kalnytskyi.com> 1701047519 +0200

Keep an async function marker when @pass_ is used

Unfortunately, when the `@picobox.pass_()` decorator is used, a wrapped
coroutine function (i.e. an async function) loses its a coroutine
function marker, i.e. `inspect.iscoroutinefunction()` returns `False`
for such function.

Turns out that there are a lot of software out there that support both
sync and async interfaces, and may choose one based on the type of a
passed function. For instance, Starlette, a web-framework, checks a
provided route function for being a coroutine function before choosing
how to execute in (i.e. in an event loop or in a thread pool).

This patch fixes `@picobox.pass_()` to return a coroutine function when
a wrapped function is also a coroutine function.

Fixes #78

commit.message:
Revive Read-the-Docs publishing

Apparently, the picobox documentation wasn't published for the 3.0
release because the Read-the-Docs platform started to require its own
configuration file [1], `.readthedocs.yaml`, for publishing to work.

[1]: https://blog.readthedocs.com/migrate-configuration-v2/

tree 7a40df092be22f9bedafbd75cb2ef9602fb06f33

Revive Read-the-Docs publishing

Apparently, the picobox documentation wasn't published for the 3.0
release because the Read-the-Docs platform started to require its own
configuration file [1], `.readthedocs.yaml`, for publishing to work.

[1]: https://blog.readthedocs.com/migrate-configuration-v2/

commit.message:
Update badges in README.rst

Although I'm not a huge fan of badges since they might be misleading in
release branches and/or tags, they are seem to be widespread and
popular. Let's show some badges about the most latest release on PyPI.
